content.description: Contrived fitness problem. Start on slopers at the bottom of the horizontal cylinder shaped boulder. Traverse away from the creek. The full line traverses all the way right until reaching the jug horn and mantling.
content.location: Park in the same lot as Dagobah and Tucked Away. Cross the road and start on the Scout Trail (no signage at the trail entry). On the trail across the road of the parking lot, you should hit a wooden sign with arrows and marked "4." You have four options, one of them is down to the creek. Take that path, and take a right when you hit the creek (don't cross the creek). Creek should be on your left. After hiking along with the creek on your left side for about 1/4 mile, the boulder sits right on the creek to the left of the trail.

content.description: Move up from the big sharp jug to more good holds and a mantle top out.
content.location: Make your way down the main drag in Chewacla State Park. After passing over the bridge and rounding a curve you'll see a parking lot on your right. Park here and cross the road to get on the trail. On the trail, you should hit a wooden sign with arrows and marked "4." You have four options, one of them is down to the river. If you look down that path, take the trail on the left and stay right on every fork. You'll get really close to the creek, but before you do, you'll go over a large rock on the trail. You're on top of "Tucked Away" and then a few more feet, another large rock. You're on top of "Dagobah."

content.description: Start on the bottom left of the boulder using an undercling and the adjacent block for feet. Make your way out and up using some powerful and technical moves.
content.location: Go all the way up to the "top" of Chewacla State Park. Take the trail down to the waterfall. At the bottom of the cascade the boulder looms over a small pond.

content.description: Technical and sharp. Start with your left hand on a white crimp and your right on an undercling. Move out right using a sharp sloper and side-pull before catching a couple good edges. The problem requires you traverse all the way right to the jug sidepull to easily rock up on good feet. Similar to Wannabe Hard Man, early exits don’t count for this line.
content.location: Take the same path to this boulder as you would to approach Wannabe Hard Man. It lies less than 1/5 of a mile from the road on your left right by the creek and just left of the Scout Trail. On the trail across the road of the parking lot, you should hit a wooden sign with arrows and marked "4." You have four options, one of them is down to the creek. Take that path, and take a right when you hit the creek (don't cross the creek). Creek should be on your left as stated before. Road on your right.  (See photos for a view of the top of the boulder from the Scout Trail)

content.description: Sit start at left end of boulder using a small two-finger crimp for right hand and the smooth arete for left hand, make a series of bumps up the arete, keep it tight and top out. Scrunchy start with bad feet, but makes for a much more difficult variation of the original route.
content.location: Follow the trail down to the bottom of the falls on the left side, leading to a small clearing with the boulder on your obvious left

content.description: Starting holds indicated on picture. Bump right hand to large hold.
content.location: From parking lot go behind pavilion and down the hill. Right beside 'Pops' Jacuzzi'

content.description: Sit start under and using the crack in the face. Move up the crack to a small right hand pocket. From here rock up to a right hand side pull that has a key thumb-catch. Move out to a sharp left hand crimp in order to situate yourself for the move to the left hand sloper. Once the sloper is caught, use the top of the boulder, good feet, and the helpful tree at the top to finish it out.
content.protection: The landing is sketchy and falls away. Protection is up to you. EVERYTHING RIGHT OF THE YELLOW LINE IN THE PICTURE BELOW IS OFF DUE TO SKETCHY ROCK QUALITY.
content.location: The boulder is on the far side of the cascading creek if approaching from the "trail to waterfall". It is clearly visible if you are standing on top of Tom Sawyer.

content.description: Start on ledge on far left side of boulder, and use one jug and the slopey side of boulder to get to the top.
content.protection: pads, landing is a little sketch
content.location: Make your way down the main drag in Chewacla State Park. After passing over the bridge and rounding a curve you'll see a parking lot on your right. Park here and cross the road to get on the trail. On the trail, you should hit a wooden sign with arrows and marked "4." You have four options, one of them is down to the river. If you look down that path, take the trail on the left and stay right on every fork. You'll get really close to the creek, but before you do, you'll go over a large rock on the trail. You're on top of the Tucked Away bloc. Rizah Blites is on the far left of the bloc.

content.description: Start literally above a puddle, so if you fall it's in a nasty stagnant puddle. Really straight forward edges you can see for holds. 4 on the wall and the edge running on the top of course.
content.location: Same boulder as rugged mug but on the left of it.

content.description: Starting holds indicated on picture
content.location: To the right of 'Schadenfreude'

content.description: View second image for highlighted holds. Two handed start on some slightly crimpy underclings. Move up left to the crimp and right to the knife-like rock. Then move up left or right to the big ol' jug. From there top out. WARNING: top out is rather slopey so be aware of that. If you Ignore the marked holds the route is a V0-1
content.location:
In the far back parking lot of the park there is a concrete picnic table.  There's at least 5 routes "behind the pavilion." If you're at the water spout at said parking lot, you'll see a random large rock in the middle of the grass and a picnic table just past that rock. Follow that direction and the trail left of the picnic table.

 You'll see another picnic table past the foliage on the right side of the trail. You've gone way about double the distance if you hit a split near the creek and are standing next to event horizon and ascendance.

content.description: Small boulder on left - feet only.
content.location: Underhang, left hand pinch on arete. Underhang, right hand jug. Left foot small boulder. Right foot flag or hang

content.description: Super easy, but it's a nice warm up and only slab I found. Plenty of cracks to change it up and make it harder.
content.location: Pretty hidden but it's uphill NE of ascendance and the other one on that boulder.  You can tell it's the one when you see the slap coming up with a dominantly orange base that changed to spotty light green top. Good bit of foliage on and around it.

content.description: Straightforward climbing on harder holds. Start with the undercling crack that Ascendence works, go straight up to the crimp on a sloped sphere, high right hand reach to a bad, angled side pull, step your feet up to hold the left hand undercling. Finish with a sketchy mantle move on the ledge before the peak.
content.location: The straight vertical line at the start of Ascendence

content.description: Start matched on the obvious jug shelf to the right, make big move with left hand towards a pretty bad crimp on the far left, & work your magic by using the crack to gain the top.I can't be the first one to do this route, but wanted to put it up for others to see/know about. FA'er please claim if you see.
content.location: Located on the same boulder as 'Genesis', directly on the trail to the left before you reach the boulders on the river

content.description: Starting holds indicated on picture. Use Crack.
content.location: From the waterfall go left.

content.description: Bump from starting holds to ridge and climb to the end.
content.location: At the bottom of the falls. To the left of 'Ascendance'.

content.description: Start with your left hand on the sharp rail and right hand on the arete. Work your way up using the arete and a left hand crimp to finish with an easy mantle top out.
content.location: Make your way down the main drag in Chewacla State Park. After passing over the bridge and rounding a curve you will see a parking lot on your right. Park here and cross the road, you should hit a wooden sign with arrows and marked "4." You have four options, one of them is down to the river. If you look down that path, take the trail on the left and stay right on every fork. You'll get really close to the creek, but before you do, you'll go over a large rock on the trail. You're on top of "Tucked Away" and then a few more feet, another large rock. You're on top of "Dagobah."  Dagobah sits right over the creek where it bends and where the small rapids are.

content.description: Refer to the pictures for holds. Big lunge left to the sidepull then bump that right hand up till you can hit the last crimp with the left. Top out straight up. The entire boulder is on a fairly steep slope so crashpads and spotters are a must. Sketchy fall, watch those ankles.
content.location:
Directly right of Margaret's knife. 

 Come straight down the hill behind the pavilion (in the big parking lot). A bit above Schadenfreude and Pops Jacuzzi. It's a nice huge face, can't miss it.

content.description: Stand start to the left of the climb.
content.location: Bottom of the falls, large boulder on your left.

content.description: Start the problem at the bottom of the "wave", make your way across the traverse using the topside of the boulder for sloping holds and some heel hooking. Nearing the end and top of the wave, utilization of a left hand press can help you rock over onto the boulder.
content.protection: Up to you. The landing is quite poor.
content.location: Backside of Tom Sawyer.

content.description:
Chewacla State Park's 696 scenic acres is know for its hiking trails, picnicking, mountain biking, camping, and swimming, but there's quite a bit more to it. What it also provides is undiscovered bouldering waiting to be found. Most routes are fairly short with difficult/technical starts. Some areas may need a small amount of clearing, but please do not remove plant life if not necessary. Please clean up after yourself. Whatever you bring in, be sure to take it back with you. 

  Entrance fee is $4.00.   Dogs are allowed on leashes.
